org.strongback.drive

Class TankDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongback.drive.TankDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Requirable

    public class TankDrive
extends Object
implements Requirable
    Control logic for a tank/skid-style drive system. This controller provides arcade-style, tank-style, and cheesy-style inputs.

    This drive implements Requirable so that Commands can use it directly when executing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TankDrive

        public TankDrive(Motor left,
                 Motor right)
        Creates a new DriveSystem subsystem that uses the supplied drive train and no shifter. The voltage send to the drive train is limited to [-1.0,1.0].
        Parameters:
        left - the left motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        right - the right motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null

      • TankDrive

        public TankDrive(Motor left,
                 Motor right,
                 Relay shifter)
        Creates a new DriveSystem subsystem that uses the supplied drive train and optional shifter. The voltage send to the drive train is limited to [-1.0,1.0].
        Parameters:
        left - the left motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        right - the right motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        shifter - the optional shifter used to put the transmission into high gear; may be null if there is no shifter

      • TankDrive

        public TankDrive(Motor left,
                 Motor right,
                 Relay shifter,
                 DoubleToDoubleFunction speedLimiter)
        Creates a new DriveSystem subsystem that uses the supplied drive train and optional shifter. The voltage send to the drive train is limited by the given function.
        Parameters:
        left - the left motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        right - the right motor on the drive train for the robot; may not be null
        shifter - the optional shifter used to put the transmission into high gear; may be null
        speedLimiter - the function that limits the speed sent to the drive train; if null, then a default clamping function is used to limit to the range [-1.0,1.0]

    • Method Detail

      • highGear

        public void highGear()
        Shift the transmission into high gear. This method does nothing if the drive train has no transmission shifter.

      • lowGear

        public void lowGear()
        Shift the transmission into low gear. This method does nothing if the drive train has no transmission shifter.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the drive train. This sets the left and right motor speeds to 0, and shifts to low gear.

      • arcade

        public void arcade(double driveSpeed,
                   double turnSpeed)
        Arcade drive implements single stick driving. This function lets you directly provide joystick values from any source.
        Parameters:
        driveSpeed - the value to use for forwards/backwards; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        turnSpeed - the value to use for the rotate right/left; must be -1 to 1, inclusive

      • arcade

        public void arcade(double driveSpeed,
                   double turnSpeed,
                   boolean squaredInputs)
        Arcade drive implements single stick driving. This function lets you directly provide joystick values from any source.
        Parameters:
        driveSpeed - the value to use for forwards/backwards; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        turnSpeed - the value to use for the rotate right/left; must be -1 to 1, inclusive Negative values turn right; positive values turn left.
        squaredInputs - if set, decreases the sensitivity at low speeds

      • tank

        public void tank(double leftSpeed,
                 double rightSpeed,
                 boolean squaredInputs)
        Provide tank steering using the stored robot configuration. This function lets you directly provide joystick values from any source.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - The value of the left stick; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        rightSpeed - The value of the right stick; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        squaredInputs - Setting this parameter to true decreases the sensitivity at lower speeds

      • tank

        public void tank(double leftSpeed,
                 double rightSpeed)
        Provide tank steering using the stored robot configuration. This function lets you directly provide joystick values from any source.
        Parameters:
        leftSpeed - The value of the left stick; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        rightSpeed - The value of the right stick; must be -1 to 1, inclusive

      • cheesy

        public void cheesy(double throttle,
                   double wheel,
                   boolean isQuickTurn)
        Provide "cheesy drive" steering using a steering wheel and throttle. This function lets you directly provide joystick values from any source.
        Parameters:
        throttle - the value of the throttle; must be -1 to 1, inclusive
        wheel - the value of the steering wheel; must be -1 to 1, inclusive Negative values turn right; positive values turn left.
        isQuickTurn - true if the quick-turn button is pressed
        See Also:
        Team 254 Cheesy Drive logic
